pullRequest.body:
This PR adds a type class `HasOuterApproxClosed` for topological spaces in which indicator functions of closed sets can be approximated from above by sequences of bounded continuous functions. All pseudo-(e)metrizable spaces satisfy this.

In spaces with this property, finite Borel measures are characterized by the integrals of bounded continuous functions. Also weak limits of finite Borel measures are unique. More precisely, the topologies of weak convergence of finite Borel measures and of Borel probability measures are Hausdorff.

Co-authored-by: Peter Pfaffelhuber <p.p@stochastik.uni-freiburg.de>

---

In addition, the assumptions in one implication of the portmanteau theorem are weakened from `PseudoEMetricSpace` to `HasOuterApproxClosed`. At the very least this covers all `PseudoMetrizableSpace`s, so that only the topology plays a role, not the choice of the (e)metric.

Peter Pfaffelhuber is marked as a co-author, because he [proved the uniqueness of weak limits](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Probability.20Distributions/near/364376899) earlier ;). Thanks!

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
bors r+
Thanks, that's great!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7082970479/job/19274563948)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7082970479/job/19274563606)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7082970479/job/19274563742)

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.Hausdorff import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.Lebesgue.Basic ```

```suggestion
lemma isPiSystem_set_isClosed [TopologicalSpace α] : IsPiSystem (IsClosed : Set α → Prop) :=
```
It would be better to name it `isPiSystem_isClosed`, since there is already `isPiSystem_isOpen`

This looks like a strange formulation to me. Don't you want instead to record an instance that the space of probability measures is T2, to be able to apply then the general result `tendsto_nhds_unique`

I am planning to introduce the Lévy-Prokhorov metric in #8719, and with it eventually provide a `MetrizableSpace` instance on finite Borel measures on separable metric spaces (and the present PR is meant to slightly facilitate some lemmas there as well). That generality is by far the most important case in my opinion, but having one formulation of uniqueness of limits without assuming separability and metrizability at least explicitly sounded like a reasonable additional lemma.

Because of this, I was unsure about recording instances here yet --- I don't understand typeclass instance loops well enough. Specifically, is it not a problem if in the most important case there is a direct `T2Space` instance and one derived from `MetrizableSpace`?

It sounds like a good idea anyway to write a proof of `T2Space (FiniteMeasure Ω)`, and if it is safe to record that as an instance, I will be happy to do so.
There is now `MeasureTheory.FiniteMeasure.t2Space` as a lemma, but not yet as an instance. I refactored the proof here so that it uses that lemma.

There is no issue with instance loops in Mathlib4. But even here, there wouldn't be any loop, just two different ways to derive a T2 instance. So, you can safely make it an instance! (And then delete the lema `tendsto_nhds_unique` as it becomes a particular case of a general lemma).
Weird grammar?

Yes, sorry! I struggled and still struggle to find a concise phrasing here (the title should fit in a line of 100 characters), and apparently had given up before coming up with a satisfactory one. I think all of the following are kind of essential to specify: "closed sets", "sequences" (countability of the approximation), "continuous functions", and "from above".

I now changed the title to "Spaces where indicators of closed sets have approximations by sequences of continuous functions", the main text gives a slightly more precise formulation. (I.e., I left out the quite essential "from above" / "decreasing approximation".) At least the title should be grammatically acceptable now.
Actually "Spaces where indicators of closed sets have decreasing approximations by continuous functions" seems better. So the countability of the approximation is now left implicit in the title.

This looks pretty hard to read. Why not use the automatic coercion framework, and just write
```
    (fs_lim : ∀ᵐ ω : Ω ∂μ, Tendsto (fun i : ι ↦ fs i ω) L
```
?
Same thing below.

Indeed. The mathlib3 version was
`(fs_lim : ∀ᵐ (ω : Ω) ∂μ, tendsto (λ (i : ι), (coe_fn : (Ω →ᵇ ℝ≥0) → (Ω → ℝ≥0)) (fs i) ω) L (𝓝 (indicator E (λ x, (1 : ℝ≥0)) ω))) `
and the existing Mathlib4 version seems like a literal port. I don't remember why (or whether) the mathlib3 version needed that cumbersome type annotation, but you suggestion is definitely an improvement to readability. Thanks!
I'll change `=>` to `↦` throughout at the same time.

```suggestion
  exAppr : ∀ (F : Set X), IsClosed F → ∃ (fseq : ℕ → (X →ᵇ ℝ≥0)),
```

```suggestion
class HasOuterApproxClosed (X : Type*) [TopologicalSpace X] : Prop where
```
Please do this everywhere, `Type _` has several flaws that `Type*` circumvent.
Why not spell it instead as `hF.apprSeq n x = 1` directly? I don't expect that you will ever need the inequality if the equality is available.
You don't need `IsFiniteMeasure`, as you can deduce it from your assumption applied to the constant function 1. Same thing in next lemma.

I think you can streamline a lot this proof, by saying that if you have an embedding to a T2 space then you are T2, with the following sketch:
```lean
    T2Space (FiniteMeasure Ω) := by
  let f := (toWeakDualBCNN : FiniteMeasure Ω → _) 
  have : Function.Injective f := sorry
  exact Embedding.t2Space ⟨⟨rfl⟩, this⟩
```
(And then you can remove the previous lemma). It's maybe even worth having a standalone lemma saying that `toWeakDualBCNN` is an embedding?

Indeed, obviously better, thank you!

I stated separately both injectivity of `toWeakDualBCNN` (which is a statement very much in the spirit of the PR, basically a rephrasing of `ext_of_forall_lintegral_eq` that is more convenient for the topology of weak convergence), and the fact that it is an embedding (which becomes trivial). And then `T2Space (FiniteMeasure Ω)` is a one-liner, like it is in the probability measure case, too.

To use `variable`s, I created some new sections, because for these lemmas I need to replace the previously assumed `OpensMeasurableSpace Ω` by the stronger `BorelSpace Ω`, and I need to assume `HasOuterApproxClosed Ω` in addition. Similarly in `ProbabilityMeasure.lean`, although there is currently only the `T2Space` declaration there (but the intended variable scope seems clearer with sections).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: uniqueness of weak limits of finite measures
